instruction: Reduce the following text to 100 words.
input: The word for word repetition of a section of dialogue, especially the first one, is a common feature in television commercials. It's a strategy often used to emphasize the point that's being made and to give the audience time to really process the message. The repetition can also be used to make sure the audience is really paying attention and deter them from tuning out or changing the channel. The use of a specific phrase in this way facilitates memorization as it is an indication to the viewer that this point is important.
output: The repetition of a phrase in a television commercial is a common strategy used to emphasize its point and make sure the audience is paying attention. It gives viewers time to process the message and helps them remember it. This strategy has many practical applications and can be used for both comedic and serious purposes. Repetition is a powerful tool in television advertising and can be used to great effect if used correctly.
